name: mystical
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to the belief that there is hidden meaning in life, or that each human being can unite with God: a mystical religion She joined a religious community after having a series of mystical visions. Synonym
mystic
relating to magic or having magic powers, especially of a secret, dark, or mysterious kind: Often these rather mystical stories he told were interrupted by his phone, which made an amusing contrast. The colour scheme combines the stable and calming aspects of blue with the mystical and spiritual qualities of purple. Synonym
mystic
More examplesFewer examplesIn the summer of 1929, he went through a mystical experience.People have an almost mystical link with the land. There is nothing magical or mystical about hypnotism as many may think.The mystical allure of the truffle spans the centuries.
